project_overview.summary: Polar Polar is a playable artifact that creates temporary topographic images with audible elements based on the player's motor input. By engaging the player's body (action of playing and listening), the players' experience oscillates between the modes of "Playing a musical instrument" and "Playing a ball-in-a-maze puzzle," creating a sense of exploration and engagement.

featured_image_with_text.content:
The collection comprises a combination of a ball-in-a-maze puzzle and a free-wheel spinning apparatus that is used to manipulate a magnetic sphere on a standalone platform.

In contrast to loudspeaker units that remove the permanent magnet and employ only a voice coil, Polar Polar ingeniously transforms this "empty area" into a dynamic element that players maneuver using a magnetic ball within the puzzle.

featured_text_1.content: During Sónar HK 2019, Polar Polar was showcased in the outdoor section of Hong Kong Science Park.

subtitle_and_body_1.subtitle: Discovery and participation
subtitle_and_body_1.body: The player's experience intertwines physical interaction, rhythmic movements, problem-solving, and a harmonious fusion of sound and gameplay, fostering exploration and engagement.

highlighted_content_with_gallery_2.title: Collaboration
highlighted_content_with_gallery_2.content: Polar Polar offers rental and permanent setup options, with flexible sound, shape, and size of units. We embrace various opportunities and are open to collaborating on diverse projects.
